mods.abstract: Female, girl, Kruse, Kathe doll, composition head on cloth body, painted and molded features, blonde wig, jointed at shoulders and hips, white cotton underwear with lace trimming, white dress with lace trimmed collar, big ribbon tied at back, flat soled shoes with socks, stamped on bottom of shoes, '5' on one label, 'Original Kathe Kruse PUPPE', on second label, 'Original Kathe Kruse Stuffpuppe, handgeknupft'. Accompanying information describes that the doll was placed on marked in 1914. Doll is made by hand. Dress is made by hand, and stuffed with cotton, during the war Kathe Kruse fell under the displeasure of Adolf Hitler because the face of the dolls showed too much sorrow. Kathe Kruse lost her young son during the war and showed so much sorrow in her own face, Hitler closed the factory and forbade Kathe to make any more dolls. She outlived the war and is making dolls still in 1968. Kathe Kruse's early dolls were first shown in America in 1911. (Ref. 1)""
mods.accessCondition: Please submit an LSU Special Collections reference ticket at https://askus.lib.lsu.edu/special for any questions or comments about this digital object.

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
